definition: to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of

sentences.english: I think next time I want to see a comedy.
sentences.chinese: 我想下次我要看一部搞笑片。

sentences.english: The professor is really hilarious and funny. He makes it very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 教授真的很搞笑很滑稽，他課講很有意思。

sentences.english: They are more funny, I guess, just from brilliant entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 更搞笑，覺得，只是從娛樂效果來說。

sentences.english: His colleagues baited him about his funny haircut.
sentences.chinese: 他的同事們拿他的搞笑髮型開涮。

sentences.english: I gaped , thinking at first that he must be doing some kind of comedy act.
sentences.chinese: 我打了個哈欠，我開始心想他肯定是做了搞笑的事情。

sentences.english: Then there's the other you—the one with the E-mail address and voice mail greeting that your friends find hilarious.
sentences.chinese: 另一個你，則是一個給朋友發搞笑語音郵件的傢伙。

sentences.english: They decided that the daily emails should have funny copy.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲，日常電子郵件應該附搞笑動畫。

sentences.english: The cartoon characters as US-based, the plot is known for comedy.
sentences.chinese: 該漫畫由於人物美型，情節搞笑而著稱。

sentences.english: Our hilarious Ant-Man had a funny fight with Falcon.
sentences.chinese: 獵鷹和我們新任的逗逼蟻人在這裏有了場搞笑的對決。

sentences.english: This is the sign of women's room. Is it funny?
sentences.chinese: 這是女廁所的標誌，很搞笑吧？

sentences.english: Mario-style platform game about a cute duck named Charlie.
sentences.chinese: 搞笑風格的一個名叫查理可愛的鴨子平臺遊戲。

sentences.english: Just think of your favorite comedians.
sentences.chinese: 想想你最愛的搞笑藝人。

sentences.english: Y. -based trade group. Any non- romantic cards stick to humor between friends.
sentences.chinese: 送給朋友的非浪漫卡片還是以幽默搞笑爲主。

sentences.english: At there they were just straining along, because he was so entertaining.
sentences.chinese: 他們一直不給他錢，因爲他太搞笑了。

sentences.english: I did this in front of a customer who said something about America's Funniest Home Videos…
sentences.chinese: 他只是跟我聊起了美國最搞笑的家庭劇而已。

definition: to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
comedic material/(in reference to a person) laughingstock/butt of jokes
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
